fields.title: Gaussian process classification
fields.pointers:
* We can approximate the solution to GP classification using the  [Laplace approximation](gp_classification_laplace) .
* Gaussian processes have a variety of uses in machine learning, including:
**  [regression](gaussian_process_regression)
**  [black-box optimization](bayesian_optimization)  (where we only get to evaluate the function, and doing so is expensive)
**  [reinforcement learning](gaussian_processes_for_reinforcement_learning)
* Techniques for  [constructing kernel functions](constructing_kernels)
fields.summary: Gaussian process classification is a Bayesian model for nonparametric classification. The data points have associated latent variables which are drawn from a GP prior, and the labels are modeled as stochastic functions of the latent variables.
